articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman on Talks between DPRK and Russia
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman on Talks between DPRK and Russia
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry today gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA as regards the talks held between foreign ministers of the DPRK and Russia in Moscow:
					 Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK on a visit to Russia at the invitation of its Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, had talks with his Russian counterpart and signed the 2011-2012 plan for exchange between the two foreign ministries in Moscow on December 13.
					
					 At the talks both sides estimated the fact that the two countries jointly commemorated in a significant manner the 10th anniversary of the DPRK-Russia joint declaration and the conclusion of the DPRK-Russia treaty this year and had an in-depth discussion on the matters of further developing the traditional DPRK-Russia relations of friendship and cooperation before reaching an agreement of views.
					
					 An open-hearted exchange of views was also made there on regional and international issues of mutual concern.
					
					 The Russian side gave a profound understanding of the DPRK's stand toward the grave situation recently prevailed on the Korean Peninsula and expressed deep apprehension over the facts that the Yonphyong Island incident occurred due to south Korea's provocation and the U.S. and south Korea have staged large-scale military exercises one after another, steadily aggravating the situation of the peninsula.
					
					 On the LWR construction and production of enriched uranium for fuel supply by the DPRK, the Russian side took notice of the DPRK's stand that nuclear activity for peaceful purposes is the independent right of each country.
					
					 Both sides agreed to make joint efforts to defend peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula through bilateral and multilateral talks, including the six-party talks, in keeping with the spirit of respect for sovereignty and the principle of simultaneous action stipulated in the September 19 Joint Statement.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK and Russia FMs Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Russia FMs Held 
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Talks between DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov took place in Moscow on December 13.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were the foreign minister and his party and Ambassador to Russia Kim Yong Jae and from the Russian side Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Aleksei Borodavkin and other officials concerned.
					
					  At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Russia, the situation on the Korean Peninsula and other issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: 2011-2012 Plan for Exchange between DPRK and Russia Inked
articles.content:
2011-2012 Plan for Exchange between DPRK and Russia Inked
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A 2011-2012 plan for exchange between the foreign ministries of the DPRK and Russia was signed in Moscow on Monday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and his party and Ambassador to Russia Kim Yong Jae and from the Russian side Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, Vice-Foreign Minister Aleksei Borodavkin and others. 
					
					 The two ministers inked the plan.

articles.title: CPRK on DPRK Will Never Pardon Anyone Who Slanders Its Dignity
articles.content:
CPRK on DPRK Will Never Pardon Anyone Who Slanders Its Dignity
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA on Tuesday blasting the chief executive of south Korea for letting loose vituperation against the DPRK recently:  
					 Traitor Lee Myung Bak in his appearance at a "forum", press conference and round-table talks during his recent junket to Southeast Asia let loose a whole string of jargons about "bellicose nature", "changes" and "responsibility" and the like, daring take issue with the leadership and system in the DPRK. 
					
					 He did not hesitate to let loose a string of such insulting remarks as "it is irresistible" and "unification is drawing close," while impudently ballyhooing about "basic right" and "right to happiness."
					
					 The traitor malignantly slandered the DPRK's system at the social coordinating committee under the puppet president on Dec. 3, talking about "changes" and the like. 
					
					 As the "reckless remarks" made by the traitor sparked off great concern in south Korea, minions of Chongwadae, much upset by the development, hastily made excuses, asserting that they were just a "theory" and "impromptu remarks" as there were not such utterances in the prepared information to be reported. 
					
					 If he uttered what had not been contained in the original text of his speech, he should have brought into bolder relief his black-hearted intention. 
					
					 Lee is going free to make anti-reunification and confrontation remarks getting on the nerves of the other side, strutting about here and there without being careful about his tongue-lashing unsuitable to his position. The people from all walks of life in south Korea and public opinion at home and abroad are stunned by his demeanor. 
					
					 In the past, too, the traitor spoke ill of the socialist system in the DPRK, talking rubbish about its people's life and economy. Not content with this, he spelled out what he called "unification tax," disclosing his sinister intention. He made no scruple of jabbering that "he is now satisfied with the policy toward the north and ready to get the inter-Korean relations frozen while he is in office."
					
					 All these facts clearly indicate that it is none other than Lee who is wholly to blame for having driven the inter-Korean relations into catastrophe. 
					
					 What Lee uttered is touching off bitter indignation of not only the people in the DPRK but of all other Koreans as it is a politically motivated unpardonable provocation to the DPRK. 
					
					 Lee had better mind the society in south Korea on the brink of ruin before daring slander someone's system. 
					
					 South Korea has turned into a mourning house due to the group of traitors' pro-American fascist dictatorial rule and madcap moves for a war.
					
					 The people's resentment is running high and the "National Assembly" has turned into a scene of philistines' violence. 
					
					 The present conservative group of south Korea is locked in wrangles at home and abroad. 
					
					 What the traitor uttered this or that about the ever-victorious DPRK and its single-mindedly united people only betrays his ignorance and folly. 
					
					 The DPRK will never pardon anyone who dares slander its inviolable dignity and system.
					
					 If Lee does not wish to see the inter-Korean relations reach an uncontrollable catastrophe, he had better stop dishonest remarks causing trouble and properly wag his tongue.

articles.title: Art Performance Given by KPA Servicepersons
articles.content:
Art Performance Given by KPA Servicepersons
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by company servicepersons of the Korean People's Army who proved successful at the 34th art festival of KPA servicepersons at the Mansudae Art Theatre Tuesday.
					 It was appreciated by senior officials of the state, the chairperson of a friendly party and officials of the armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, creators, artistes, journalists and media persons in the fields of culture and art and press organs.
					
					 Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as narration and chorus "Glory to Our Great Party", dialogic poem "The General and Our  Tulggot Company", male chorus "Arms and Soldier", discharged cartridge flute concert "My Song in the Trench" and narration and song "Where Are You, Dear General?" an immortal masterpiece.
					
					 The performers enthusiastically sang of the exploits leader Kim Jong Il has performed by building the Korean revolutionary armed forces into an invincible army and bringing about world-startling miracles and changes in defending socialism and building a rich and powerful country and truthfully represented the pride and happiness of the servicepersons,  each being a-match-for-a hundred fighters.

articles.title: Kwangmyong Encyclopedia Vol. 5 Published
articles.content:
Kwangmyong Encyclopedia Vol. 5 Published
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Science and Encyclopedia Publishing House of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has brought out Kwangmyong Encyclopedia Vol. 5 dealing with economic affairs.
					 The dictionary consists of seven parts and 40 chapters.
					
					 It, on the basis of the Juche-oriented ideas and theories of the Workers' Party of Korea on the economy, gives a general understanding of the economy and knowledge of the capitalist economy, socialist economy, history of the Korean economy, history of economic theories, etc.
					
					 It will be of help to the people in the effort for the building of a thriving nation and to the economic development of the country.

articles.title: Fossil Whale Bones Discovered
articles.content:
Fossil Whale Bones Discovered 
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Fossil whale bones dating back to some 10,000 years ago have been discovered on the lower Songchon River in Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 A scientific analysis proved that they are a left lower jaw and second cervical vertebra of an arctic whale.
					
					 The lower jaw is some 70 kg in weight and 2.27 meters in length and the cervical vertebra weighs some 18 kg in weight and is 40 cm high and 52 cm wide. It is believed that when alive, the whale was some 100 tons in weight and 18-18.5 meters in length. 
					
					 Dr. and Associate Prof. Won Chol Guk, a department chief of Kim Il Sung University, told KCNA the fact that such mammoth vertebrates as arctic whale had lived in the East Sea of Korea some 10,000 years ago was of significance in studying the evolution of marine vertebrates and ecological environment at that time.
					
					 It is the first time that such large fossil whale bones were discovered in Korea.

articles.title: Industrial Establishments Reinforced
articles.content:
Industrial Establishments Reinforced
						
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Great achievements have been made in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea this year in the effort for making national economy Juche-oriented.
					The February 8 Vinalon Complex built a modern vinalon factory based on latest science and technologies by itself to greatly contribute to the people's clothing.
					
					The Namhung Youth Chemical Complex has introduced DCS in the anthracite gasification process for fertilizer production.
					
					The Ryongsong Machine Complex has equipped itself with a modern casting factory with sand mixing, molding, melting, desanding and all other processes controlled by computer to sharply decrease the consumption of manpower and electricity and increase the quality casting output. 
					
					The Taegyedo Tideland on the West Sea of Korea has been reclaimed to acquire new cropland as large as that of a county in a flat area.
					
					The Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex has turned out steel from an up-to-date curved type strand-casting machine, boosting the iron pig production, and the Chollima Steel Complex has been furnished with another UHP electric arc furnace and revolving furnace to raise the steel production.
					
					Foodstuff and daily necessities factories and enterprises, including the reconstructed Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory and Pyongyang Flour-Processing Factory, have massproduced what is necessary for the betterment of the people's living.
					
					The workers of the country are now striving hard to wrap up this year's campaign with greater achievements under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: US Secretary of State's Outbursts Dismissed
articles.content:
US Secretary of State's Outbursts Dismissed
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. secretary of State was recently reported to have asserted that an arms race would be sparked off within the year due to the nuclear program of the DPRK. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: 
					
					 It is the inviolable sovereign right of every country of the world to conduct nuclear activities for peaceful purposes. It is nonsensical for the U.S. secretary of State to talk about the DPRK's "nuclear program" and "sparking off an arms race" and the like. 
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 If she were to mention the issues of nuclear program and the start of an arms race worldwide from a fair stand, she should have taken issue with the arms buildup and development of nukes by the U.S. and its followers, to begin with. 
					
					 The danger of a new arms race is increasing on the international arena at present entirely because of the U.S. policy of hegemony and strength. The U.S. is frantically pushing forward development, production and deployment of new type modern weapons to realize its ambition for world domination on the basis of upperhand of strength. 
					
					 The smear campaign stepped up by the U.S. against the DPRK over its nuclear activities for peaceful purposes is nothing but a crafty artifice to build public opinion critical of the nuclear program of the DPRK in a bid to shift the blame for the former's criminal acts of sparking off and escalating the arms race and creating the danger of a nuclear war onto others. The U.S. authorities' outcry over the start of arms race due to the nuclear program of the DPRK is no more than sheer sophism let loose by those feeling guilty. 
					
					 If the U.S. undisguisedly keeps to the road of bolstering nuclear forces, building missile shields and stepping up its moves for a war, this will throw the world deep into a whirlwind of new arms race. With no honeyed words can the U.S. cover up its true colors as a chieftain of arms race and an arch criminal disturbing world peace and stability.

articles.title: US Imperialists' Crafty Psychological Warfare Assailed
articles.content:
US Imperialists' Crafty Psychological Warfare Assailed 
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists are waging a vicious psychological warfare on the basis of modern science and technology after designating the anti-imperialist independent countries as targets of their attack, observes Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a signed article.
					 It is the national policy of the U.S. imperialists to conduct the above-said warfare by use of modern scientific and technological means, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 They worked out a detailed plan for psychological warfare in advance against those countries which they had designated as targets of their attack and included it in the "state general strategy and political tactics" in a bid to push it forward in a coordinated manner in political, economic, diplomatic, military and other fields. 
					
					  U.S. intelligence gathering bodies and their affiliated institutions are now busy widely using modern scientific and technological means for the psychological warfare. A huge amount of money is now being allocated for this and plots are being hatched to make a maximum use of it in practice.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists' criminal psychological warfare teaches a bitter lesson to the anti-imperialist independent countries.
					
					 Now that the above-said warfare is getting more frantic as the days go by it is necessary not to neglect the ideological education of the people and youth and children, in particular, even a moment.
					
					 The present IT age calls for channeling big efforts into the development of science, technology and IT. This provides an important way for effectively countering the U.S. imperialists' psychological warfare.
					
					 It is also necessary to strengthen the education aimed to help the people properly understand the methods, danger and harmfulness of the above-said warfare.
					
					 Only when the anti-imperialist independent countries stand firm against the said warfare, can they protect the sovereignty of the country and nation and emerge victorious in the anti-U.S. struggle.

articles.title: Yonphyong Island Shelling Branded as Provocation to DPRK
articles.content:
Yonphyong Island Shelling Branded as Provocation to DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities have misled public opinion by asserting that the recent case of the Yonphyong Island shelling occurred due to the DPRK. This is nothing but a revelation of the scheme to dodge their criminal responsibility for the grave military provocation and finally ignite a war of aggression against the DPRK by kicking off another armed clash on a larger scale.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a signed article.
					
					 Terming the shelling incident a provocation to the DPRK as it was carefully worked out in advance and deliberately perpetrated by the south Korean warmongers under the wire-pulling of the U.S. from A to Z, the article goes on to say:
					
					 The gravity of the incident finds itself in the fact that it was an intentional firing to kick off the military clash with the DPRK and a premeditated provocation aimed at thoroughly destroying the inter-Korean relations and igniting a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 This is clearly evidenced by the racket for confrontation and war frantically staged by the puppet forces with the incident as a momentum.
					
					 The puppet group, in collusion with the U.S., has already worked out various scenarios for preemptive attack on the DPRK and is watching for a chance to put them into practice. What remains for them to do is to kick off a tremendous armed provocation going beyond the Yonphyong Island shelling and then ignite another Korean war.
					
					 The south Korean bellicose forces can never take issue with the legitimate self-defensive countermeasure taken by the DPRK nor can they dodge the blame for having committed the hideous provocation to drive the Korean Peninsula into touch-and-go situation.
					
					 It is a pipedream for the south Korean authorities to seek a way out in doing harm to the fellow countrymen by force of arms with help of foreign forces. Their desperate moves for confrontation with the DPRK and provocation to unleash a war against it will only reveal their bellicose nature before the entire nation and the world.

articles.title: S. Korean Minister of Unification's Reckless Remarks Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Minister of Unification's Reckless Remarks Flayed
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- South Korean puppet minister of Unification Hyon In Thaek let loose a spate of outbursts seriously getting on the nerves of the DPRK, talking about "the last option" and the like as regards the Yonphyong Island shelling incident. He went the lengths of talking nonsense about "freedom and human rights" and "democracy and market economy" and crying out for "carving out future on the Korean Peninsula with the initiative on the part of south Korea" by using them as a "value."
					  Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					  Hyon's reckless remarks disclose his sinister intention to pass the buck for the Yonphyong Island shelling incident on to the DPRK at any cost and escalate the moves for confrontation and war in an effort to put the puppet forces' old scenario for "unifying the systems" into practice without fail.
					
					 The puppet warmongers fabricated the shelling incident on Yonphyong Island in a premeditated manner under the patronage and wirepulling of the U.S. in a bid to throw a wet blanket on the atmosphere of improving the inter-Korean relations and secure a legal pretext for igniting a war against the DPRK. This being a hard reality, Hyon dared lay the blame for this at its door, vociferating about "the last option" and the like. This is the height of shamelessness.
					
					 What Hyon uttered about the "future" on the peninsula, talking about "human rights" and "market economy" is, in essence, a declaration of the treacherous "unification of the systems", the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is widely known that the south Korean conservative group has made desperate efforts to realize "unification under liberal democracy" after defining it as the main goal of its "policy toward the north." Hyon has taken the lead in this campaign.
					
					 The south Korean ruling forces are making uproar over the "provocation" from the north. The above-said reckless remarks made by them go to prove that the Lee Myung Bak group is trouble makers and dangerous provocateurs escalating the distrust and confrontation between the north and the south and the tension on the peninsula.

articles.title: KCNA Warns Militarist Japan of Its War Hysteria
articles.content:
KCNA Warns Militarist Japan of Its War Hysteria
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The preservation of peace and stability in Northeast Asia has become a main concern of the international community. Quite contrary to this, military moves have gained in scope and strength in Japan. 
					 Japan is persistently calling for the reexamination of the "three principles of arms export" which it has advocated under the signboard of "building a pacifist state" since the 1960s while contemplating setting up the General Command of the Ground Force for an effective operation of the "Self-Defense Forces". 
					
					 This is needless to say a premeditated and systematic move to round off the moves for turning Japan into a military giant and the preparations for reinvasion. 
					
					 The said principles have been proved to be a mere facade since the very day they were touted. Japan-made weapon parts have been ceaselessly exported to the United States for the production of war equipment and they have been used in various wars of aggression including the Persian Gulf War, unbound to the above-said principles. 
					
					 When the issue of jointly developing the Missile Defense System with the U.S. was raised, the Japanese authorities openly buckled down to scrapping those principles, a nuisance to them, as if they had been waiting for it. 
					
					 It was part of that move that the Japanese prime minister recently gave an official approval of the re-examination of the principles. 
					
					 Japan's abandonment of those principles is a revelation of its arrogance as it self-exposed that it is no longer a "pacifist state" but a war state. 
					
					 Since the demise of the Cold War Japan had asserted the building of a "country capable of fighting wars." But it is now rushing headlong into a war. 
					
					 Even at this time when the situation in the region has grown extremely tense, Japan is making a switchover in its military doctrine from a system for building basic defence forces to that for building mobile defence forces in a bid to turn the SDF into "very active 'SDF'", an army capable of fighting wars. Japan's plan to set up the General Command of the Ground Force tasked for coordinating the contacts among various forces under the joint chiefs of staff which has a general command over the operations of the SDF and the Ground SDF is nothing but a detailed part of the radical process for comprehensively rounding off the preparations for reinvasion. 
					
					 The Japanese prime minister has gone the lengths of talking about the dispatch of the SDF to the Korean Peninsula in "contingency" without hesitation. This is a clear proof that an arrow for launching its reinvasion has been drawn on the map of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 Munitions monopoly capital which has swollen to the maximum under the patronage of the U.S. is behind these frantic moves for reinvasion in Japan.
					
					 The Japanese munitions industries are driving Japan into the joint development of military equipment and the performance of joint operations with the U.S., persistently requesting the Japanese authorities to ease the said principles. These moves are accelerating the formation of the U.S-led triangular military alliance in Northeast Asia and increasing the danger of war resulting from them. 
					
					 Japanese militarism is becoming more arrogant through the process for emerging a military power as the days go by and challenging humankind as a hotbed of war threatening peace and stability in this region. 
					
					 The international community is following with vigilance the crafty and reckless moves of the Japanese reactionaries to step up their moves to turn Japan into a military power and the preparations for reinvasion backed by the U.S., while deliberately straining the situation in the region.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Its Moves to Cover up Introduction of Nuclear Weapons
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Its Moves to Cover up Introduction of Nuclear Weapons
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- According to the recently declassified diplomatic document of the Japanese Foreign Ministry, the then Foreign Minister of Japan Kosaka and U.S. Secretary of State Rusk worked out a document at the talks held in November 1961. Kosaka was reported to have implored the U.S. to keep in top secrecy the deployment in Okinawa of medium-range ballistic missiles capable of carrying nuclear warheads, saying that the government would be censured for failing to check it in case this fact was disclosed. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary in this regard.
					
					 This goes to prove how craftily and viciously the Japanese government worked to cover up the introduction of nuclear weapons into the territory of Japan, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					 Japan took the stand of opposing nuclear weapons after the Second World War in a bid to draw global attention. But "the three non-nuclear principles" touted by Japan is no more than a smokescreen to cover up its criminal intention to go nuclear.
					
					 Citing facts to prove that Japan has secretly pushed ahead with its moves to go nuclear behind the curtain of "the three non-nuclear principles" since the 1960s, the commentary goes on:
					
					 It was disclosed once again that the Japanese government worked hard to conceal the introduction of nukes, not content with letting the U.S. ship them into Japan at a time when the world is becoming cautious about the evermore undisguised moves of Japan to turn itself into a military power and launch its overseas expansion. This has heightened the vigilance among members of the international community against Japan.
					
					 Japan's loudmouthed "three non-nuclear principles" is nothing but a mere facade for realizing its nuclear ambition. Its trumpeting about "pacifist state" is no more than wordplay to deceive the world.
					
					 The veil of "non-nuclear state" worn by Japan so far has been completely thrown off.

articles.title: Tuition-waiver Program to Korean Schools Demanded in Japan
articles.content:
Tuition-waiver Program to Korean Schools Demanded in Japan 
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- People of various circles in Japan are becoming increasingly vocal protesting against the Japanese government's suspension of the procedures for the application of the tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools as regards the situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula.
					 The Liaison Council against the Exclusion of Korean Schools from the Application of the Tuition-waiver Program for Senior High Schools sent written requests for the application of the above-said program to the prime minister and the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology.
					
					 The Society for Assisting Korean Schools in Fukuoka Prefecture and the Free Legal Panel, an organization of lawyers, in their statements urged the authorities not to deliberately mix politics with the education issue.
					
					 The "Liaison Council Demanding Denuclearization and Peace in Northeast Asia and Normalization of Relations between Japan and the DPRK" in a statement called for providing all children with the right to learn and right to national education.
					
					 The written requests and statements censured in unison the exclusion of only the Korean schools from the application of the above-said program, declaring that this is little short of the Japanese government's agitation of the national discrimination.

articles.title: US-S. Korean Forces' Moves for Invading DPRK Slammed
articles.content:
US-S. Korean Forces' Moves for Invading DPRK Slammed
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- An organization of Malta and a figure of a regional organization denounced the U.S. and the south Korean puppet warmongers for their reckless moves for invading the DPRK.
					 The Malta-Korea Friendship Association in a statement on December 6 expressed full support for the measures for self-defence taken by the DPRK to cope with the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces' moves to provoke a war.
					
					  It went on:
					
					  The DPRK has a strong military muscle and is advantageous in every aspect as it is guided by the great Juche idea.
					
					  Lyne Sinyodyium, director of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, said in a statement on December 7 that the U.S. and its followers south Korean authorities are wholly to blame for escalating tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					  The U.S. and the south Korean authorities would be well advised to stop their rash acts, properly understanding the invincible might of the Korean People's Army possessed of powerful nuclear deterrent and modern military equipment and prepared to wipe out any enemy at one blow under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il, he stressed.
					
					  Meanwhile, Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, when interviewed by reporters on the situation on the peninsula on November 24, accused south Korea of committing military provocations in waters of the West Sea of Korea despite repeated warnings of the KPA.
					
					  If the U.S. and south Korea intrude into the territory of the DPRK, they will not be able to escape powerful retaliatory blows of the KPA, he warned.

articles.title: DPRK Important Days Observed
articles.content:
DPRK Important Days Observed 
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of opening a Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition, a lecture and a film show were held in Brazil, a meeting in Nigeria and a film show in the Czech Republic between December 6 and 9 to mark the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					 Displayed in the venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal feats, photos on the successes made by the Korean people in building a great prosperous and powerful nation and handicrafts associated with creative wisdom and skills of the Korean nation.
					
					 Appreciated at the shows were such Korean films as "Pyongyang Today", "Reply of Korea" and "Pyongyang at Night".
					
					 The general secretary of the Federation of Trade Unions of Brazil said at the exhibition-opening ceremony that Kim Jong Il has built up the Korean People's Army into a strong army capable of repelling any formidable enemy with his Songun politics.
					
					 The chairman of the federation said in the lecture that under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people have secured the military capability strong enough to resolutely repulse any provocation of the imperialists. 
					
					 He accused the U.S. and the south Korean authorities of getting hell-bent on the moves to slander and stifle socialist Korea and ceaselessly staging war exercises for aggression in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The speakers at a meeting in Nigeria highly praised the validity and vitality of the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il and the immortal feats of Kim Jong Suk.

articles.title: Conversan en Moscu cancilleres de Corea y Rusia
articles.content:
Conversan en Moscu cancilleres de Corea y Rusia
Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 13 en Moscu las conversaciones entre el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea Pak Ui Chun y su homologo ruso Serguei Lavrov.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion la comitiva de Pak y el embajador coreano en Rusia, Kim Yong Jae por la parte coreana y por la rusa, el vicecanciller Alexei Borodavkin y otros funcionarios.
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron sus opiniones sobre los asuntos de interes mutuo como el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-Rusia y la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Rubricado plan de intercambio entre Corea y Rusia
articles.content:
Rubricado plan de intercambio entre Corea y Rusia
Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Quedo firmado el dia 13 en Moscu el plan de intercambio 2011-2012 entre las cancillerias de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y de la Federacion Rusa.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ceremonia de firmas el canciller Pak Ui Chun y su comitiva y el embajador coreano en Rusia Kim Yong Jae por la parte coreana, y por la rusa, el canciller Serguei Lavrov, el vicecanciller Alexei Borodavkin y otros funcionarios.
					
					Los cancilleres de ambas partes subscribieron el documento.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun rechaza acusacion de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun rechaza acusacion de EE.UU.
						
 Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Recientemente, la secretaria de Estado de EE.UU. dijo que "se desataria dentro de este ano la carrera armamentista" debido al "programa nuclear" de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					  Las actividades nucleares con fines pacificos son el derecho soberano de todos los paises del mundo que nadie puede impedir.
					
					  Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este martes y continua.
					
					  Es muy absurdo que la secretaria de Estado norteamericana hablara del "programa nuclear" de la RPDC y de la "provocacion de carrera armamentista" a escala mundial.
					
					  Si ella hubiera tomado la posicion imparcial al abordar esos temas, habria cuestionado primero el aumento armamentista y el desarrollo de armas nucleares por parte de EE.UU. y sus satelites.
					
					  Actualmente, crece en la arena internacional el peligro de nueva carrera armamentista debido a la politica de hegemonia y garrote de EE.UU. 
					
					Partiendo de su ambicion de tomar la heguemonia mundial a base de la superioridad de la fuerza, EE.UU. acelera freneticamente el desarrollo, la produccion y el emplazamiento de nuevas armas modernas.
					
					  EE.UU. cuestiona las actividades nucleares con fines pacificos de la RPDC en su astuto intento de imputar la responsabilidad del fomento de la carrera armamentista y del peligro de guerra nuclear.
					
					  Si EE.UU. sigue impulsando abiertamente como ahora el aumento de fuerzas armadas nucleares, el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles y la campana guerrerista, el mundo sera empantanado en la nueva carrera armamentista. 
					
					  El imperio no puede ocultar de ninguna manera su fachada de culpable de la carrera armamentista y de destructor de la paz y estabilidad del mundo.

articles.title: Viento de guerra proviene del Japon militarista, comenta ATCC
articles.content:
Viento de guerra proviene del Japon militarista, comenta ATCC
						
Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Actualmente, la sociedad internacional esta interesada en preservar la paz y la estabilidad del Nordeste Asiatico. En contraste, en Japon entran en etapa crucial los movimientos militares. 
					Ese pais isleno se obstina en la revision de los "3 principios de exportacion de armas" preconizados desde la decada de 1960 bajo el rotulo de la "construccion del Estado pacifista" y, al mismo tiempo, pretende instalar la comandancia terrestre general para la operacion efectiva de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa".
					
					No cabe duda de que tales movimientos sistematicos y premeditados son para convertirse en una potencia militar y perfeccionar los preparativos de nueva agresion.
					
					Los "3 principios de exportacion de armas" resultaron superficiales desde el principio. 
					
					Sin respetar esos principios que prohiben la exportacion de armas de Japon, los accesorios de armas japoneses fueron exportados sin parar para la produccion de equipos belicos de EE.UU. y usados en las guerras de agresion como la del Golfo Persico. 
					
					Cuando se presento el problema de desarrollo conjunto del sistema antimisiles con EE.UU., las autoridades japonesas procedieron abiertamente a la cancelacion de esos principios que las molestan.
					
					En este contexto, el premier japones aprobo oficialmente hace poco la revision de ellos. 
					
					Este hecho significa que Japon ya no es un "Estado pacifica" sino pais belicista.
					
					Despues del fin de la guerra fria, Japon vino insistiendo en la construccion del "pais capaz de hacer la guerra" y ahora marcha a galopes en esta direccion. 
					
					En estos tiempos en que la situacion regional es extremadamente tensa, modifico su doctrina militar sobre la capacidad defensiva basica en el sentido de que las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" fueran las activas y beligerantes. 
					
					La instalacion de la comandancia terrestre general, que coordinara los vinculos entre el jefe del Estado Mayor encargado de dirigir todas las operaciones y las tropas de "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" en diferentes zonas, forma parte de los preparativos finales de nueva agresion. 
					
					Para colmo, el premier japones habla sin escrupulos del envio de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" a la Peninsula Coreana en el tiempo de emergencia. Esto es una prueba evidente de que la flecha de reagresion de Japon esta dirigida a la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  Detras de esa frenetica campana, esta el capital monopolista de industria belica de Japon expandido al maximo bajo la proteccion de EE.UU.
					
					  Los complejos de industria belica de Japon piden obstinadamente a las autoridades relajar los "3 principios de exportacion de armas" para que su pais pueda desarrollar equipos militares y cumplir operaciones junto con EE.UU. Por consiguiente, en el Nordeste Asiatico se impulsa la formacion de la alianza militar tripartita que aumenta el peligro de guerra.
					
					  El militarismo japones se torna cada dia mas arrogante mediante la conversion en una potencia militar. Ademas, desafia a la humanidad como factor de guerra que amenaza la paz y la estabilidad de la region.
					
					  La sociedad internacional vigila agudamente las imprudentes y astutas maniobras de los reaccionarios japoneses que aceleran la conversion de su pais en una potencia militar y los preparativos de la regresion agravando adrede la situacion regional bajo el abrigo de EE.UU.
